title: How to Trade Locally on Pokémon ORAS

steps.title: Unfortunately, there’s no way to do a Wonder Trade as of April 2024.
steps.content: Unfortunately, there’s no way to do a Wonder Trade as of April 2024. Nintendo has closed down the servers for all Wii U and 3DS systems, discontinuing many Pokémon Alpha Sapphire and Omega Ruby features in the process. One of these now-discontinued features is the Wonder Trade—now that the servers are closed down, there’s no way to do it. [1] X Research source Local Pokémon trading doesn’t rely on these servers, so these features aren’t impacted by the server closure. With local trades, you and your trading partner are in control over what Pokémon you trade, while the Pokémon you receive in a wonder trade is totally random.

steps.title: Make sure that you and your trading partner are nearby.
steps.content: Make sure that you and your trading partner are nearby. As the name suggests, local wireless trading requires both devices to be close together. Check that you both have StreetPass enabled in your 3DS settings. Although Nintendo disabled 3DS online services, most StreetPass features are still available. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open up your game and go to the Player Search System.
steps.content: Open up your game and go to the Player Search System. You can find it on the PlayNav screen in-game, along with the Pokémon-Amie and Super Training widgets.

steps.title: Tap your friend’s icon.
steps.content: Tap your friend’s icon. Assuming that your friend is already added on your device, their icon should automatically pop up if they have their game open.

steps.title: Tap the “Trade” button to get started.
steps.content: Tap the “Trade” button to get started. This button sits above the “Wonder Trade” option. Proceed with your trade as you normally would.

steps.title: Makuhita: Rustboro City
steps.content: Makuhita: Rustboro City Find the Pokémon Gym in Rustboro City, and then travel to the house directly to the right of it. Speak with the blue-haired child, who will give you a Makuhita if you give him a Slakoth. [3] X Research source Slakoth is a Normal-Type Pokémon, while Makuhita is a Fighting-Type Pokémon

steps.title: Skitty: Fortree City
steps.content: Skitty: Fortree City Head in a northwestern direction as you journey through Fortress City, until you find the last possible house available. Inside the house (which should have a giant tree. Chat with the girl inside, who will give you a Skitty in exchange for a Plusle. [4] X Research source Plusle is an Electric-Type Pokémon, while Skitty is a Normal-Type Pokémon.

steps.title: Corsola: Pacifidlog Town
steps.content: Corsola: Pacifidlog Town Head to the lower/southern section of Pacidlog Town, and enter the central-most house. Chat with the girl inside and give her a Bellossom in exchange for a Corsola. Corsola is a Rock- and Water-Type Pokémon, while Bellossum is a Grass-Type Pokémon. You get by giving a Gloom Pokémon a Sun Stone (rather than a Leaf Stone, which evolves it into Vileplume). [5] X Research source
